member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.WCF.Configuration.Manageability.FaultContractExceptionHandlerDataManageabilityProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the clas.
Adds the ADM instructions that describe the policies that can be used to override the properties of a specific instance of the configuration element type managed by the receiver.
member.param: The to which the Adm instructions are to be appended.
The configuration source from where to get additional configuration information, if necessary.
The key for the element's policies.
member.remarks:
The default implementation for this method creates a policy, using to create the policy name and invoking
to add the policy parts. Subclasses managing objects that must not create a policy must override this method to just add the parts.

member.summary: Adds the ADM parts that represent the properties of a specific instance of the configuration element type managed by the receiver.
member.param: The to which the Adm instructions are to be appended.
The configuration source from where to get additional configuration information, if necessary.
The key for the element's policies.
member.remarks: Subclasses managing objects that must not create a policy will likely need to include the elements' keys when creating the parts.

member.summary: Overrides the 's properties with the Group Policy values from the registry.
member.param: The configuration object for instances that must be managed.
The which holds the Group Policy overrides for the configuration element.
member.remarks: Subclasses implementing this method must retrieve all the override values from the registry before making modifications to the so any error retrieving the override values will cancel policy processing.

member.summary: Creates the instances that describe the configurationObject.
member.param: The configuration object for instances that must be managed.
A collection to where the generated WMI objects are to be added.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.WCF.Configuration.Manageability.FaultContractExceptionHandlerDataManageabilityProvider.ElementPolicyNameTemplate
member.summary: Gets the template for the name of the policy associated to the object.
member.remarks:
Elements that override
to avoid creating a policy must still override this property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.WCF.ExceptionShieldingAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that an implementation service class will use exception shielding.
member.remarks: Add this attribute to your service implementation class or your service contract interface and configure your host configuration file to use the Enterprise Library Exception Handling Application Block adding the class to the exceptionHandlers collection and set your FaultContract type that maps to a particular exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.WCF.FaultContractExceptionHandler
member.summary: Exception handler that gets the configured fault contract type and wraps it inside a . exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.WCF.FaultContractExceptionHandler.#ctor(System.Type,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.WCF.FaultContractExceptionHandler.#ctor(System.Type,System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A fixed exception message that will replace the fault contract message.

A collection of nam value paries that specify the mapping between the properties of the FaultContract class and the values in the instance. You can specify something like: FaultPropertyName = "{Message}" where {Message} points to the Message property value of the current exception. You can also specify a {Guid} value that will load the current exception handlingInstanceId value. See . NOTICE that names and values are case sensitive.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.WCF.FaultContractExceptionHandler.HandleException(System.Exception,System.Guid)
member.summary: Handles the exception.
member.param: The handling instance id. This value may be injected into the current FaultContract by spefifying the attribute value "{Guid}".
